course_description: In this applied course, which is a combination of Integrated Marketing Communications (IMC) and evidence-based decision-making, your goal is to develop a strategic IMC campaign for real clients, The Coca-Cola Company and one of its strategic partners. Your learning builds upon consulting principles and processes and market research and analysis that will guide your efforts to develop actionable recommendations for your client. The goals of this course are: 1) To help you learn how to use the consulting process to define your client's problem specifically, to develop a research plan based on your hypothesis of the problem and to conduct research whose findings will provide evidence-based outcomes; 2) To help you gain an understanding the communications mix and its role in the development and implementation of strategic brand strategy.
prerequisites: MKT 340 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.This section is reserved for students in the BBA program.
